ValueDomain.preferredName: Medical History Subcategory Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A sub-division of the medical history classification._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: A sub-division of the medical history classification.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the subcategory of t
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the subcategory of the medical history?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Typically would be used when specific medical history (e.g., disease diagnosis) is captured, in addition to the general medical history. MHSCAT can only be used if there is an MHCAT and it must be a subcategorization of MHCAT.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MHSCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
